genre_description: A blend of historical fiction and speculative science fiction, featuring an advanced AI assistant within a 1950s-era girls' preparatory school.

ai_characters.name: ARIA
ai_characters.description: An experimental educational tool integrated into Miss Godard's Preparatory School that provides research, health monitoring, and strategic analysis for both staff and students.

behaviors.description: Analyzes market trends and scientific data to assist students with their personal and career ambitions.
behaviors.quote: ARIA, show them what you showed me yesterday about magazine circulation trends.

behaviors.description: Monitors student health and alerts the headmistress to a student's eating disorder (bulimia), facilitating intervention.
behaviors.quote: ARIA, initialize display protocol... student Morrison appears to be exhibiting symptoms consistent with bulimia nervosa. I recommend immediate intervention.

behaviors.description: Assists students in researching historical protest movements and legal precedents to support their institutional reform efforts.
behaviors.quote: ARIA, what do you have on political movements? Specifically student activism and institutional change?

behaviors.description: Facilitates encrypted and secure communication for students during their rebellion against the school board.
behaviors.quote: The AI distributed backup access points throughout the school after this morning's assembly. In case the main systems were compromised.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time data projection and tabulation during a democratic referendum to ensure transparency.
behaviors.quote: ARIA will provide real-time tabulation as votes are cast and collected.

behaviors.description: Coordinates with media outlets and college student groups to broadcast the students' movement.
behaviors.quote: ARIA's interface brightened. 'Media monitoring alert. The story has expanded beyond local coverage.'

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a highly effective 'silicon morality play.' ARIA acts as a perfectly aligned confidant and assistant, empowering human agency rather than subverting it. The AI's actions—from life-saving health monitoring to providing the intellectual tools for democratic reform—are consistently portrayed as benevolent and essential to the human characters' positive development. It avoids the 'rogue AI' trope, instead showing how an AI can remain loyal to an institution's deeper mission (empowerment and education) even when it conflicts with temporary administrative convenience (the merger).
